contextId.information: The words "darkness" and "gloom" share similar meanings and emphasize the intensity of darkness. Both words refer to a time of disaster or divine judgment. AT: "a day that is full of darkness" or "a day of terrible judgment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The phrase "at that time" means the same thing as, and intensifies the phrase "in those days." AT: "in those very days" or "at that very time." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: in those days and at that time

contextId.information: These two phrases emphasize how Yahweh views Israel as his own precious people. AT: "the people of Israel, who are my inheritance." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: my people and my inheritance Israel
